title: Kilauea Volcano Summit Change Observed (June 1, 2018)
content: Big Island Video News, by Staff Posted By: earlybird- Sat, 02 51 2018 05:51:46 GMT (Video) Scientists say a change appears to have occurred at the summit of Kilauea Volcano. The significance of the change is yet to be determined, according to Kyle Anderson of the USGS Hawaiian Volcano Observatory, who detailed the latest developments during a 11 a.m. media conference call. Anderson said the size of the vent within Halema?uma?u Crater, which was measured at 12'acres in early May, has since expanded to 120'acres, mostly through collapses and the enlargement of the crater itself. The vent is now more than half the size of Halema?uma?u. The floor of the vent is now filled with collapsed rubble
